intro: Alsinastrum brachyspermum, commonly known as goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its rapid growth and ability to spread vegetatively, it is considered a weed in many areas.
